issue.title: Mac Function Key InvalidValue: Invalid scancode

labels.name: upstream
labels.description: A bug that likely comes from upstream

repository.name: fyne
repository.description: Cross platform GUI toolkit in Go inspired by Material Design

issue.body:
In the advanced tab of fyne_demo, fn key does not show up when pressed, however console contains:
```
2020/05/22 09:30:05 Fyne error:  GLFW poll event error: InvalidValue: Invalid scancode
2020/05/22 09:30:05   At: /Users/stuartscott/Documents/Projects/Go/src/fyne.io/fyne/internal/driver/glfw/loop.go:203
```

- MacOSX Catalina
- fyne@develop(5eea431d182608269e41a9d927985972df6e1c61)

issue.title: v3.3/glfw: GetKeyName incorrectly panics on unknown key and scancode
issue.body:
We have a few issues open for cases where we are recovering from a panic in cases where a button that GLFW gets an invalid scancode because of keys that it doesn't recognize (https://github.com/search?q=repo%3Afyne-io%2Ffyne+poll+event+error++&type=issues&state=open). This is currently being handled by deferring a recover function:
https://github.com/fyne-io/fyne/blob/dc34dad76137def4466ab8eb4166e7ae741ef9ee/internal/driver/glfw/loop_desktop.go#L28-L34

It would be nice if we could teach `acceptError()` to avoid issuing a panic in this case.

body: There is currently no key token to assign to the <kbd>Fn</kbd> key, but the error should finally be fixed with 86bf5698ecfdbe783135ffaf72972a8c562c0fdf. Thank you for the bug report!

issue.title: Panic on Wayland on 2020 M1 Air when "fn" key is pressed

repository.name: supersonic
repository.description: A lightweight and full-featured cross-platform desktop client for self-hosted music servers

issue.body:
As in title.

When running `supersonic-wayland` on NixOS on a 2020 M1 Air, it crashes with the below stacktrace whenever I press the "fn" key.
This is most likely a Fyne/glfw bug, but it's happening on Supersonic.

There's a few similar issues, but they're all related to the "fn" key on MacOS, not on Linux-on-Apple-hardware.

https://github.com/go-gl/glfw/issues/386
https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/1785
https://github.com/glfw/glfw/issues/1785

```
$ supersonic-wayland 
2025/10/04 11:42:01 Starting supersonic...
2025/10/04 11:42:01 Using config dir: /home/zane/.config/supersonic
2025/10/04 11:42:01 Using cache dir: /home/zane/.cache/supersonic
2025/10/04 11:42:01 failed to load theme file "": open /home/zane/.config/supersonic/themes: no such file or directory
2025/10/04 11:42:02 PlatformError: Wayland: Focusing a window requires user interaction
2025/10/04 11:42:02 Fyne error:  Preferences API requires a unique ID, use app.NewWithID() or the FyneApp.toml ID field
2025/10/04 11:42:02   At: fyne.io/fyne/v2@v2.6.1/app/app.go:61
2025/10/04 11:42:02 Playback error (SeekSeconds): failed to execute command [seek 342.8 absolute]: mpv error -12: MPV_ERROR -12 error running command
panic: InvalidValue: Wayland: Invalid scancode 464

goroutine 1 [running, locked to thread]:
github.com/go-gl/glfw/v3.3/glfw.acceptError({0x0, 0x0, 0x1?})

github.com/go-gl/glfw/v3.3/glfw.GetKeyName(0x4000791818?, 0x8b2fe8?)
        github.com/go-gl/glfw/v3.3/glfw@v0.0.0-20240506104042-037f3cc74f2a/input.go:445 +0x3c
fyne.io/fyne/v2/internal/driver/glfw.keyToName(0xffffffffffffffff, 0x1d0)
        fyne.io/fyne/v2@v2.6.1/internal/driver/glfw/window_desktop.go:605 +0x40
fyne.io/fyne/v2/internal/driver/glfw.(*window).keyPressed(0x40000d2000, 0x177cd230?, 0xffffffffffffffff, 0x1d0, 0x1, 0x0)

github.com/go-gl/glfw/v3.3/glfw.goKeyCB(0x40007918b8?, 0xffffffff, 0x1d0, 0x1, 0x0)

fyne.io/fyne/v2/internal/driver/glfw.(*gLDriver).pollEvents(...)
```
